help_desc: Um mehr Infos zu einem Command zu erhalten, nutze ``{prefix}help <command>``
softban_help: Softbannt den angegebenen User vom Server (Ban & Unban)
hackban_help: Bannt den angegebenen User (auch wenn dieser nicht auf dem Server ist)
mute_help: Mutet (timeoutet) den angegebenen User oder verlängert seinen Mute
unmute_help: Unmutet den angegebenen User (entfernt seinen Timeout)
clean_help: Standart Command um Nachrichten zu löschen. Subcommands führen eigentliche Löschung durch
clean_all_help: Löscht zwischen 1 und 300 Nachrichten aus dem Channel
clean_user_help: Löscht zwischen 1 und 300 Nachrichten des angegebenen Users
commands_help: Standart Command um Custom Commands zu verwalten. Wenn kein Subcommand gegeben ist, wird eine List aller Custom Commands dieses Servers angezeigt
commands_add_help: Fügt einen neuen Custom Command mit dem angegebenen Namen & Content hinzu
commands_remove_help: Entfernt den Custom Command mit dem gegebenen Namen
commands_update_help: Updatet den Content des Custom Commands mit dem gegebenen Namen
about_help: Zeigt einige Statistiken und Infos über AutoMod
help_help: Zeigt Hilfe für einen bestimmten (sub-)command oder eine Liste aller Commands, wenn genutzt ohne Argumente
avatar_help: Zeigt eine größere Version des User Avatars
jumbo_help: Zeigt eine größere Version eines oder mehrerer Emotes
punishment_help: Fügt eine Aktion für die angegebene Anzahl an Verwarnungen hinzu
log_help: Standart Command für die Log Konfiguration. Nutze entweder einen Kanal als zweites Argument um die Log Option zu aktivieren, oder **off** um sie zu deaktivieren
automod_help: Standart Command für die Automoderator Konfiguration. Nutze **off** als zweites Argument in allen Commands um diese jeweils zu deaktivieren
allowed_invites_help: Standart Command zum Verwalten der Invite Whitelist. Wenn kein Subcommand gegeben ist, dann zeigt dies die aktuelle Invite Whitelist an
allowed_invites_add_help: Fügt einen Server zur Invite Whitelist hinzu
allowed_invites_remove_help: Entfernt einen Server von der Invite Whitelist
link_blacklist_help: Standart Command zum Verwalten der Link Blacklist. Wenn kein Subcommand gegeben ist, dann zeigt dies die aktuelle Link Blacklist an
link_blacklist_add_help: Fügt eine Domain zur Link Blacklist hinzu
link_blacklist_remove_help: Removes a domain from the link blacklist
filter_help: Base command for managing word filters
filter_add_help: Created a filter with the given name, warns and words
filter_remove_help: Removes the filter with the specified name
filter_show_help: Shows a list of all avtive filters
mod_role_help: Sets a mod role which can bypass mod command checks, meaning users with this role can for example ban without having ban permissions. To remove the mod role, use the command again with **off** as the role argument
disable_help: Disables one or more commands and its subcommands for non-mods. To re-enable a command, use it again as the argument. If you want to disable/enable more commands, sperate them by a space
infractions_help: Checks for recent infractions. Pass in no argument to search for all infractions or pass in a user/moderator to search for cases only affecting them
case_help: Shows information about a specific case
check_help: Checks the status of a specific user
missing_user_perms: {emote} You're missing the following permissions to use this command: {perms}
missing_bot_perms: {emote} Please grant me the following permissions to use this command: {perms}
check_fail: {emote} A command check failed, looks like you're missing the required permissions
on_cooldown: {emote} Command is on cooldown, you can use it again in {retry_after} seconds
forbidden: {emote} Looks like there's a permissions error ||{exc}||
not_in_server: {emote} This user is not in the server anymore
cant_act: {emote} You're not allowed to do this
name_too_long: {emote} The command name is too long (>30 chars)
content_too_long: {emote} The command content is too long (>1900 chars)
tag_alr_exists: {emote} A command with that name already exists
tag_added: {emote} Leave it to me! Command has been created, you can use it with {prefix}{tag}
tag_doesnt_exists: {emote} A command with that name doesn't exist
no_tags: {emote} This server doesn't have any custom commands yet
role_too_high: {emote} Mute role is above my highest role. Please put it below my highest role, so I can add it to users
already_muted_description: User is already muted. Do you want to extend their mute?
about_description: AutoMod is a moderation bot with multiple, customisable features for both small and large servers. Its powerful automoderator will keep your server safe and give your mods some time to sit back and relax.
invalid_action:
{emote} This isn't a valid punishment action. Valid actions are: 
• kick 
• ban 
• mute 
• none
set_none: {emote} Removed the punishment for {warns} warns. To view all current punishments, use ``{prefix}config``
set_kick: {emote} Users will now be kicked when reaching {warns} warns. To view all current punishments, use ``{prefix}config``
set_ban: {emote} Users will now be banned when reaching {warns} warns. To view all current punishments, use ``{prefix}config``
set_mute: {emote} Users will now be muted for {length} {unit} when reaching {warns} warns. To view all current punishments, use ``{prefix}config``
time_needed: {emote} The mute option needs an additional time, for example **10m** which would mean 10 minutes.
invalid_log_option:
{emote} Invalid log option. Valid options are: 
• mod 
• server 
• messages 
• joins 
• members
invalid_log_channel:
{emote} Looks like you used to command a bit incorrect. You have to use either a valid channel or **off** as the second argument. Here's a little help: 
• ``{prefix}log {option} #channel`` - Sets the log channel 
• ``{prefix}log {option} off`` - Disables this log option
log_on: {emote} Enabled {_type} and will send them to {channel}
invalid_mod_role:
{emote} Looks like you used to command a bit incorrect. You have to use either a valid role or **off** as the second argument. Here's a little help: 
• ``{prefix}mod_role @role`` - Sets the mod role 
• ``{prefix}mod_role off`` - Removes the mod role
no_timeout_perms: {emote} The (un-)mute command now uses the timeout feature. It looks like I don't have the correct permissions to use this feature though, so please make sure to give me either the ``administrator`` permission or, if you're not comfortable with that, simply the ``Timeout Members`` permission
automod_description:
• Use ``off`` as the argument in all commands to disable the feature 
• To manage allowed invites, use the ``{prefix}allowed_invites`` command 
• To manage blacklisted links, use the ``{prefix}link_blacklist`` command 
• Actions are only taken on non-mods (People without ban members perms)
automod_commands:
``{prefix}automod invites <warns>`` - *Warns a user gets when sending Discord invites* 
 
``{prefix}automod links <warns>`` - *Warns a user gets when sending blacklisted links* 

``{prefix}automod files <warns>`` - *Warns a user gets when sending malicious files* 

``{prefix}automod mentions <number>`` - *Max number of pings allowed per message* 

``{prefix}automod zalgo <warns>`` - *Warns a user gets when sending zalgo characters*
invalid_automod_rule:
{emote} Invalid automod rule. Valid rules are: 
• mentions 
• links 
• invites 
• files  
• zalgo
invalid_automod_amount:
{emote} Looks like you used to command a bit incorrect. You have to use either a valid {field} amount/threshold or **off** as the second argument. Here's a little help: 
• ``{prefix}automod {rule} {field}`` - Enables this automod rule 
• ``{prefix}automod {rule} off`` - Disables this automod rule
set_mentions: {emote} Users will now be warned when using more than {amount} mention{plural}
set_links: {emote} Users will now receive {amount} warn{plural} when using forbidden links (configure with the ``link_blacklist`` command)
set_invites: {emote} Users will now receive {amount} warn{plural} when sending invite links (configure with the ``allowed_invites`` command)
set_files: {emote} Users will now receive {amount} warn{plural} when sending forbidden file formats
set_zalgo: {emote} Users will now receive {amount} warn{plural} when sending zalgo characters
set_links_zero: {emote} Messages will now just be deleted when containing forbidden links (configure with the ``link_blacklist`` command)
set_invites_zero: {emote} Messages will now just be deleted when containing invite links (configure with the ``allowed_invites`` command)
set_files_zero: {emote} Messages will now just be deleted when containing forbidden file formats
set_zalgo_zero: {emote} Messages will now just be deleted when containing zalgo characters
no_allowed: {emote} No server invites are currently allowed. Allow invites from a specific server by using ``{prefix}allowed_invites add <server_id>``
alr_allowed: {emote} Invites from this server are already allowed
allowed_inv: {emote} Whitelisted this server. Users will not be flagged by the automoderator when sending invites from this server (given that it's enabled)
unallowed_inv: {emote} Removed this server from the whitelist
no_links: {emote} No links are currently blacklisted. Blacklist links by using ``{prefix}link_blacklist add <url>``
allowed_link: {emote} Blacklisted this link. Users will now be flagged by the automoderator when sending it (given that it's enabled)
unallowed_link: {emote} Removed this link from the blacklist
filter_exists: {emote} A filter with that name already exists
no_filters: {emote} This server doesn't have any filters
no_filter: {emote} A filter with that name doesn't exist
searching: {emote} Looking for recent cases, this may take a bit...
no_cases: {emote} I looked everywhere, but I couldn't find any cases matching your criteria
warn_help: Adds the given amount of warns to the specified user. Default is one warn
unwarn_help: Removes the given amount of warns from the specified user. Default is one warn
http_error: {emote} There was an error while trying to fetch a bigger version of the emoji, please try again later
invalid_length_unit: Valid length units are **d**, **h**, **m**, **s**, **days**, **hours**, **minutes**, **seconds**. The maximum length is 1 year
advanced_invalid_length_unit: Valid length units are **d**, **h**, **m**, **s**, **days**, **hours**, **minutes**, **seconds**. The maximum length is 1 year
no_warns: {emote} This user doesn't have any warns
alr_cleaned: {emote} Looks like these messages have already been deleted
lvl_sys_disabled: {emote} The level system is currently disabled. You can enable it by using ``{prefix}lvl_sys``
no_changes: {emote} This wouldn't change the current command config
